0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *Wyll knows you for what you are: a charismatic scoundrel and an asset in battle. He'll probably take the news rather well.*

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *Wyll's a wild card. He seems to like you well enough, but it's hard to know how the Sword Coast's dashing champion might respond.*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *The Blade of Frontiers hunts monsters as a matter of course. He's more likely to see you as fiend than friend.*

113.speaker: Player
113.text: It's time I came clean: I'm a vampire spawn.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: It's time I came clean: I'm a vampire spawn.

53.speaker: Wyll
53.text: Come now. Did you you think I couldn't tell?

82.speaker: Wyll
82.text: Let's see. There's the pallid skin, the stealthy tendencies, the long canines -

120.speaker: Wyll
120.text: You may as well scrawl a red 'V' on your forehead.

40.speaker: Wyll
40.text: A lesser man might sever that well-coiffed head from your neck.

117.speaker: Wyll
117.text: Good thing for you I'm not such a man. Besides - not even the Blade of Frontiers is immune to your not-inconsiderable charms.

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: Hells. The very sort I vowed on my good eye to slay.

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: Yours wouldn't be the first spawn-skull I've severed, you know. In all honesty, I'm half-inclined to sever it now.

37.speaker: Wyll
37.text: Good thing for you you're so godsdamned charming. Besides, once I've made an ally, I'm not so quick to abandon him.

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: Let's make a bargain. A pact, if you will:

88.speaker: Wyll
88.text: Keep your fangs out of innocent flesh, and I won't drive a stake through your pasty-white chest.

96.speaker: Wyll
96.text: Finally - a pact I can get fully behind.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: We'll have to see what happens.

35.speaker: Wyll
35.text: Do what you must, then - and I'll do the same.

47.speaker: Wyll
47.text: But I'll leave you with some food for thought: not every bloody mess can be tidied up with a cocksure grin and a cheeky quip.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: It's time I came clean: I'm a vampire spawn.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Change your mind. It's not the right time.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: A vampire spawn. The sort of monster I swore on my good eye to slay.
11.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite A DIFFERENT companion during the night, but they woke up and discovered he was a vampire. They talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsj

14.speaker: Wyll
14.text: Yours wouldn't be the first spawn-skull I've severed, you know. Hells, I'm half-inclined to sever it now, if only for your endless insolence.

123.speaker: Wyll
123.text: Good thing for you you're so godsdamned charming.

28.speaker: Wyll
28.text: Let's have a chat, Astarion, just you and me.
28.context: InternalNodeContext: Companion confronts Avatar Astarion, telling him they know he's a vampire. Triggers if you make it to Act 2 without him telling you himself or revealing it via camp night bite scene/using bite attack in front of you.

86.speaker: Wyll
86.text: I know you're a vampire. And I think it's time you came clean.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Guilty as accused. What gave it away?

17.speaker: Wyll
17.text: Let's see. There's the pallid skin, the stealthy tendencies, the long canines -

122.speaker: Wyll
122.text: - not to mention a tell-tale tendency to bite your foes during battle.

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: You may as well scrawl a red 'V' on your forehead. Why didn't you tell me?

130.speaker: Player
130.text: You're the Blade of Frontiers. I wanted to keep my skull firmly on my shoulders.

85.speaker: Wyll
85.text: Astarion - If I wanted your well-coiffed head, I'd have already taken it. Yours wouldn't be the first spawn-skull I've severed.

90.speaker: Wyll
90.text: And you think deceit was the best way to keep your admittedly well-coiffed skull intact?

127.speaker: Wyll
127.text: I'm half-inclined to sever it now, if only for your endless insolence. Good thing for you you're   so godsdamned charming.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: My master forbids me to speak of it. And he's not exactly the forgiving type.

107.speaker: Wyll
107.text: Your tongue tied and knotted by a dominating master? The sort of hell I can relate to.

42.speaker: Wyll
42.text: A lie as obvious as those cursed fangs of yours. A lesser man might sever that well-coiffed head from your neck for the insolence.

76.speaker: Wyll
76.text: Good thing for you I'm not such a man. Besides - not even the Blade of Frontiers is immune to your not-inconsiderable charms.

49.speaker: Wyll
49.text: Let's make a bargain. A pact, if you will:

23.speaker: Wyll
23.text: Keep your fangs out of innocent flesh, and I won't drive a stake through your pasty-white chest.

15.speaker: Wyll
15.text: Finally - a pact I can get fully behind.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: We'll have to see what happens.

118.speaker: Wyll
118.text: Do what you must, then - and I'll do the same.

66.speaker: Wyll
66.text: But I'll leave you with some food for thought: not every bloody mess can be tidied up with a cocksure grin and a cheeky quip.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Honestly? I value this alliance. I didn't want to endanger it.

106.speaker: Wyll
106.text: We're being honest, are we? Then let me respond in kind: I briefly considered severing that admittedly well-coiffed head from your neck.

8.speaker: Wyll
8.text: But desperate times call for desperate alliances. And not even the Blade of Frontiers is immune to your not-inconsiderable charms.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Nonsense. I think that tadpole might have dug in a little too deep.

94.speaker: Wyll
94.text: I've spent years hunting monsters, Astarion. Do you think the Blade of Frontiers is ignorant to vampire spawn?

24.speaker: Wyll
24.text: Pallid skin, stealthy tendencies, long canines, and, ahem, a tell-tale tendency to bite your foes during battle.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I'm not a vampire, I swear it.

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: Good thing for you I'm not such a man.

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: Go on, keep up your charade. Just don't expect that ever bloody mess you make can be cleaned up with a cocksure grin and a cheeky quip.

41.speaker: Wyll
41.text: Ouch! What in the Hells? Oh shit - you're a gods-damned vampire?
41.context: InternalNodeContext: Character was bitten by Astarion in gameplay.

95.speaker: Wyll
95.text: Godsdamnit, Astarion. A lesser man would sever that well-coiffed head from your neck without a moment's hesitation.

74.speaker: Wyll
74.text: The most peaceful rest I had in ages.
74.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite this companion during the night, but you woke up and discovered he was a vampire. You talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsj

4.speaker: Wyll
4.text: Strange, given how you plunged those pointed canines right into my neck.

56.speaker: Wyll
56.text: A lesser man would sever that well-coiffed head from your neck for the insolence, without a moment's thought.

125.speaker: Wyll
125.text: Lucky for you, I'm not such a man.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: An honest mistake. I didn't mean to bite anyone.

114.speaker: Wyll
114.text: I suppose you didn't mean to keep this blood-sucking habit a secret, either? Just slipped your mind, I suppose?

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Thank you. I'm not quite the monster I seem, I promise.

22.speaker: Wyll
22.text: After your little sundown antics, I'm not sure I'm buying what you're selling.

80.speaker: Wyll
80.text: Let's make a bargain. A pact, if you will:

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: Keep your fangs out of innocent flesh, and I won't drive a stake through your pasty-white chest.

54.speaker: Wyll
54.text: Now that's a pact I can get fully behind.

108.speaker: Lae'zel
108.text: A vampire among us? So be it.

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: But should I wake with so much as a drop of blood on my neck, I will end him.

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: For his sake, he best not develop an appetite for githyanki.

38.speaker: Shadowheart
38.text: I'd just better not wake in the night to find fangs at my throat.

119.speaker: Gale
119.text: Oh, and a quick word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.

3.speaker: Gale
3.text: Well, we all have secrets in one form or another. So long as his don't come back to bite us, I'm not here to judge.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: Yeah. And I'm way too hot to touch.

27.speaker: Shadowheart
27.text: A vampire? Well that explains the pallor.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Given our group's nature, I don't see much harm. We're each monsters in the making, after all.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: So we're travelling with a vampire, are we? Of course we are.

6.speaker: Gale
6.text: Well, we all have secrets in one form or another. So long as his don't come back to bite us, I'm not here to judge.

43.speaker: Gale
43.text: A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: Vamps don't scare me. As long as they keep their teeth to themselves.

84.speaker: Karlach
84.text: No sense judging someone for who they are. Except devils, obviously.

18.speaker: Karlach
18.text: A vamp, huh? Interesting. Keep your teeth to yourself, Astarion, and we won't have any issues.

73.speaker: Karlach
73.text: Anyway, you'd burn your tongue off if you went for this neck.

135.speaker: Gale
135.text: So we're travelling with a vampire, are we?

1.speaker: Gale
1.text: Well, we all have secrets in one form or another. So long as his don't come back to bite us, I'm not one to judge.

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: We'll have to see what happens.

116.speaker: Wyll
116.text: Do what you must, then - and I'll do the same.

70.speaker: Wyll
70.text: But I'll leave you with some food for thought: not every bloody mess can be tidied up with a cocksure grin and a cheeky quip.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Don't you worry - I'll stick to cats and kobolds from now on.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I won't indulge anymore, I promise.

83.speaker: Wyll
83.text: I know how it goes with vampires and their spawn, Astarion. You can no more deny your hunger than a cat can deny its curiosity.

110.speaker: Wyll
110.text: What in the Hells? Oh shit - you're a gods-damned vampire?
110.context: InternalNodeContext: Character saw Astarion use his 'bite' ability on someone else (probably in combat, but not necessarily) and confronts him about being a vampire.
